guide.introduction: The following is a checklist of best practices for launching videos on MAKE, CRAFT, and Maker Faire.
guide.introduction_rendered: The following is a checklist of best practices for launching videos on MAKE, CRAFT, and Maker Faire.

lines.text: During editing, be sure to include the appropriate logo bug in the upper right corner.
lines.text_raw: During editing, be sure to include the appropriate logo bug in the upper right corner.

lines.text: See FCP settings screenshot
lines.text_raw: See FCP settings screenshot

lines.text: During editing, consider the ending of your video:
lines.text_raw: During editing, consider the ending of your video:

lines.text: have you asked the viewers to subscribe or check out your other episodes?
lines.text_raw: have you asked the viewers to subscribe or check out your other episodes?

lines.text: have you included clips of other episodes to later annotate on YouTube? See Becky's iPhone Gloves video as an example.
lines.text_raw: have you included clips of other episodes to later annotate on YouTube? See [http://youtu.be/ljN1vObUa5E?t=2m17s|Becky's iPhone Gloves video] as an example.

lines.text: Choose a video thumbnail. Keep in mind:
lines.text_raw: Choose a video thumbnail. Keep in mind:

lines.text: YouTube will put a big play button directly in the center of the frame
lines.text_raw: YouTube will put a big play button directly in the center of the frame

lines.text: The thumbnail should make you want to click on it
lines.text_raw: The thumbnail should make you want to click on it

lines.text: Take a screenshot or export a still frame to make your thumbnail
lines.text_raw: Take a screenshot or export a still frame to make your thumbnail

lines.text: The maximum dimensions of this image must not exceed 1280x720 pixels.
lines.text_raw: The maximum dimensions of this image must not exceed 1280x720 pixels.

lines.text: Export the different versions of the video. We need:
lines.text_raw: Export the different versions of the video. We need:

lines.text: An HD file, preferably h.264 3800 kbps with AAC audio, for launch to YouTube and Vimeo
lines.text_raw: An HD file, preferably h.264 3800 kbps with AAC audio, for launch to YouTube and Vimeo

lines.text: a podcast-friendly m4v, easy to make with the "export: movie to iPhone" settings-free option in Quicktime
lines.text_raw: a podcast-friendly m4v, easy to make with the "export: movie to iPhone" settings-free option in Quicktime

lines.text: Write up your metadata. This includes:
lines.text_raw: Write up your metadata. This includes:

lines.text: Video title
lines.text_raw: Video title

lines.text: Video description with any relavant links
lines.text_raw: Video description with any relavant links

lines.text: tags
lines.text_raw: tags

lines.text: File delivery: depending on your arrangement with your producer, you will deliver files in one of two ways.
lines.text_raw: File delivery: depending on your arrangement with your producer, you will deliver files in one of two ways.

lines.text: The simple way: Upload your HD, m4v, metadata and thumbnail image to ftp.oreilly.com in the MakeOnline folder corresponding to your name.
lines.text_raw: The simple way: Upload your HD, m4v, metadata and thumbnail image to ftp.oreilly.com in the MakeOnline folder corresponding to your name.

lines.text: The complete way: Launch the files to public servers (CDN, Vimeo, YouTube).
lines.text_raw: The complete way: Launch the files to public servers (CDN, Vimeo, YouTube).

lines.text: Draft a blog post! The text can be similar to your video description, but should include formatted HTML and related links just like any other post on our sites.
lines.text_raw: Draft a blog post! The text can be similar to your video description, but should include formatted HTML and related links just like any other post on our sites.

lines.text: Include the podcast HTML slug appopriate for your series (look at a past episode's post for example) - it will include a link to subscribe to your podcast, download the m4v, or watch on YouTube or Vimeo.
lines.text_raw: Include the podcast HTML slug appopriate for your series (look at a past episode's post for example) - it will include a link to subscribe to your podcast, download the m4v, or watch on YouTube or Vimeo.

lines.text: iTunes looks for the link to that m4v, so double check it works or the podcast won't launch in iTunes.
lines.text_raw: iTunes looks for the link to that m4v, so double check it works or the podcast won't launch in iTunes.

lines.text: Add any series and topical categories, the MAKE/CRAFT Podcast category, and don't forget a featured image (can be the same as the video thumbnail).
lines.text_raw: Add any series and topical categories, the MAKE/CRAFT Podcast category, and don't forget a featured image (can be the same as the video thumbnail).
